As first-quarter results roll out, you'll get more commentary on how tariffs will affect various businesses, but one very important company has already offered commentary on tariffs.  Taiwan Semiconductor (NYSE: TSM) is one of the world's most important companies, as it is the chip foundry for many of the world's top companies.
summary: Despite potential tariff risks from President Trump's plans, Taiwan Semiconductor (TSMC) reports no current impact on customer behavior and maintains a strong 2025 revenue growth outlook. TSMC's stock price hasn't reflected this positive outlook, presenting a potential buying opportunity for investors as the stock trades at a discount.

headline: Where Will TSMC Stock Be in 5 Years?
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE: TSM), popularly known as TSMC, has turned out to be a solid investment over the past five years.  It is expected to grow by double digits in 2025 as well, driven by the growing demand for chips in various applications such as communications, artificial intelligence (AI), defense, transportation, medical devices, and others.
summary: TSMC, the world's largest semiconductor foundry, is poised for significant growth, driven by high demand for its advanced chip manufacturing processes like the upcoming 2nm node from major players like Apple and Nvidia. Despite a recent stock dip, analysts are optimistic about TSMC's future, projecting substantial revenue growth and market share gains in the expanding semiconductor and advanced chip packaging markets over the next five years.

headline: Intel CEO in Talks with TSMC for Potential Partnership Amid Foundry Struggles
description: Insider Talks: Intel's New CEO Eyes Bold Partnership with TSMC to Jump-Start Chip Manufacturing
summary: Summary unavailable.

headline: 2 Bargain Stocks You Can't Afford to Miss Out on During the Stock Market Sell-Off
description: Two that I'm most excited about are Taiwan Semiconductor (NYSE: TSM) and The Trade Desk (NASDAQ: TTD).  Taiwan Semi is the leading contract chip manufacturer and has contracts with many of the largest tech companies around the globe.  Companies like Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) don't have chip production capabilities; they just handle end assembly of their chips.
summary: Summary unavailable.

headline: Why Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Stock Is Sinking Today
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE: TSM) stock is declining in Monday's trading following potentially significant news about competitive dynamics in the semiconductor industry.  TSMC's valuation is moving lower today following news that Chinese tech giant Huawei is testing an artificial intelligence (AI) chip that could rival Nvidia's top semiconductors.  Nvidia relies on TSMC to fabricate its semiconductor designs, and both companies occupy key positions in the broader AI hardware and tech race between the U.S. and China.
summary: TSMC stock is declining due to news that Huawei is testing an AI chip potentially rivaling Nvidia's, which could disrupt the AI market. This development suggests China is making progress in semiconductor technology with Huawei's chips being fabricated by SMIC, potentially challenging TSMC's dominance. Investors are watching to see if SMIC is catching up to TSMC in advanced chip foundry services.

headline: Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM): Among Billionaire Stephen Mandel’s Stocks with Huge Upside Potential
description: We recently published a list of Billionaire Stephen Mandel’s 10 Stocks with Huge Upside Potential. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (NYSE:TSM) stands against other billionaire Stephen Mandel’s stocks with huge upside potential. With economic policy and trade tensions fueling volatility, investors are moving […]
summary: This article highlights the importance of long-term investing in equities, citing historical data and recent market corrections to emphasize discipline and resilience. It suggests that potential Federal Reserve rate cuts could boost stock prices, particularly growth stocks, and encourages investors to consider stocks favored by successful billionaire investors like Stephen Mandel. The article then focuses on Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) as one stock with significant upside potential in Mandel's portfolio, though ultimately recommends exploring AI stocks for potentially higher returns.

headline: It's 'game over' for Nvidia in China: Huawei's reported new chip
description: Chinese tech company Huawei is reportedly working on a new artificial intelligence (AI) chip to compete with Nvidia (NVDA), according to reporting from the Wall Street Journal. Morningstar equity strategist Brian Colello joins Catalysts with Madison Mills to dive deeper into the report and what it means for US chip giant Nvidia. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.
summary: Nvidia's stock is down following reports that Huawei is developing an AI chip competitive with Nvidia's H100, leading to concerns about Nvidia's prospects in China. Morningstar analyst Brian Colello believes Nvidia's China business is essentially "game over" due to restrictions and Huawei's advancements, but remains bullish on Nvidia's overall future due to strong demand in the US and other markets driven by continued investment in AI.

headline: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (TSM) Cites Limited Control Over AI Chip Exports Amid Huawei Controversy
description: We recently compiled a list of the 12 AI Stocks Analysts Are Talking About Right Now. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (NYSE:TSM) stands against the other AI stocks. Latest reports from the IMF reveal that economic gains from artificial intelligence are likely to outweigh […]
summary: This article discusses the potential economic benefits of AI, which the IMF projects will boost global output by 0.5% annually between 2025 and 2030, while acknowledging the associated increase in carbon emissions from AI data centers. While these emissions will have a social cost, the article suggests the economic gains from AI are likely to outweigh them and highlights the importance of utilizing AI for climate action and focusing on AI stocks popular among hedge funds, citing the success of a strategy that imitates their top picks.

headline: 1 No-Brainer AI Stock Down 27% to Buy the Dip on Right Now (Hint: It's Not Nvidia)
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, often known as TSMC, is the world's biggest contract semiconductor, handling more than 50% of contract chip production in the world, and an estimated 90% of contract production for advanced chips.  TSMC is now one of the most valuable companies in the world, and it's the company that tech titans like Apple, Nvidia, Broadcom, Advanced Micro Devices, and Qualcomm, among others, making it a linchpin in the global technology supply chain.  TSMC has delivered impressive growth through the AI era, and the company benefits from significant competitive advantages in capacity, expertise, technology, and customer relationships.
summary: AI stocks have struggled in 2025 due to trade war pressures and concerns about high valuations and slowing demand. However, the article highlights Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC) as a potentially attractive investment opportunity amidst the downturn, citing its dominant position in advanced chip manufacturing and strong growth in the AI sector. TSMC's recent earnings show significant revenue growth and a focus on high-performance computing chips used in AI applications, indicating continued growth potential.

headline: Where Will TSMC Stock Be in 5 Years?

headline: Why Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Stock Is Sinking Today
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE: TSM) stock is declining in Monday's trading following potentially significant news about competitive dynamics in the semiconductor industry.  TSMC's valuation is moving lower today following news that Chinese tech giant Huawei is testing an artificial intelligence (AI) chip that could rival Nvidia's top semiconductors.  Nvidia relies on TSMC to fabricate its semiconductor designs, and both companies occupy key positions in the broader AI hardware and tech race between the U.S. and China.
summary: TSMC stock is declining due to news that Huawei is testing an AI chip potentially rivaling Nvidia's, which could disrupt the AI market. This development suggests China is making progress in semiconductor technology with Huawei's chips being fabricated by SMIC, potentially challenging TSMC's dominance. Investors are watching to see if SMIC is catching up to TSMC in advanced chip foundry services.

description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE: TSM) stock is declining in Monday's trading following potentially significant news about competitive dynamics in the semiconductor industry.  TSMC's valuation is moving lower today following news that Chinese tech giant Huawei is testing an artificial intelligence (AI) chip that could rival Nvidia's top semiconductors.  Nvidia relies on TSMC to fabricate its semiconductor designs, and both companies occupy key positions in the broader AI hardware and tech race between the U.S. and China.
summary: TSMC stock is declining due to news that Huawei is testing an AI chip potentially rivaling Nvidia's, which could disrupt the AI market. This development suggests China is making progress in semiconductor technology with Huawei's chips being fabricated by SMIC, potentially challenging TSMC's dominance. Investors are watching to see if SMIC is catching up to TSMC in advanced chip foundry services.

headline: Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM): Among Billionaire Stephen Mandel’s Stocks with Huge Upside Potential
description: We recently published a list of Billionaire Stephen Mandel’s 10 Stocks with Huge Upside Potential. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (NYSE:TSM) stands against other billionaire Stephen Mandel’s stocks with huge upside potential. With economic policy and trade tensions fueling volatility, investors are moving […]
summary: This article highlights the importance of long-term investing in equities, citing historical data and recent market corrections to emphasize discipline and resilience. It suggests that potential Federal Reserve rate cuts could boost stock prices, particularly growth stocks, and encourages investors to consider stocks favored by successful billionaire investors like Stephen Mandel. The article then focuses on Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) as one stock with significant upside potential in Mandel's portfolio, though ultimately recommends exploring AI stocks for potentially higher returns.

headline: It's 'game over' for Nvidia in China: Huawei's reported new chip
description: Chinese tech company Huawei is reportedly working on a new artificial intelligence (AI) chip to compete with Nvidia (NVDA), according to reporting from the Wall Street Journal. Morningstar equity strategist Brian Colello joins Catalysts with Madison Mills to dive deeper into the report and what it means for US chip giant Nvidia. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.
summary: Nvidia's stock is down following reports that Huawei is developing an AI chip competitive with Nvidia's H100, leading to concerns about Nvidia's prospects in China. Morningstar analyst Brian Colello believes Nvidia's China business is essentially "game over" due to restrictions and Huawei's advancements, but remains bullish on Nvidia's overall future due to strong demand in the US and other markets driven by continued investment in AI.

headline: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (TSM) Cites Limited Control Over AI Chip Exports Amid Huawei Controversy
description: We recently compiled a list of the 12 AI Stocks Analysts Are Talking About Right Now. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (NYSE:TSM) stands against the other AI stocks. Latest reports from the IMF reveal that economic gains from artificial intelligence are likely to outweigh […]
summary: This article discusses the potential economic benefits of AI, which the IMF projects will boost global output by 0.5% annually between 2025 and 2030, while acknowledging the associated increase in carbon emissions from AI data centers. While these emissions will have a social cost, the article suggests the economic gains from AI are likely to outweigh them and highlights the importance of utilizing AI for climate action and focusing on AI stocks popular among hedge funds, citing the success of a strategy that imitates their top picks.

headline: 1 No-Brainer AI Stock Down 27% to Buy the Dip on Right Now (Hint: It's Not Nvidia)
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, often known as TSMC, is the world's biggest contract semiconductor, handling more than 50% of contract chip production in the world, and an estimated 90% of contract production for advanced chips.  TSMC is now one of the most valuable companies in the world, and it's the company that tech titans like Apple, Nvidia, Broadcom, Advanced Micro Devices, and Qualcomm, among others, making it a linchpin in the global technology supply chain.  TSMC has delivered impressive growth through the AI era, and the company benefits from significant competitive advantages in capacity, expertise, technology, and customer relationships.
summary: AI stocks have struggled in 2025 due to trade war pressures and concerns about high valuations and slowing demand. However, the article highlights Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC) as a potentially attractive investment opportunity amidst the downturn, citing its dominant position in advanced chip manufacturing and strong growth in the AI sector. TSMC's recent earnings show significant revenue growth and a focus on high-performance computing chips used in AI applications, indicating continued growth potential.

headline: You'll Never Believe What Taiwan Semiconductor's CEO Said About Tariffs
description: There is a lot of speculation about the effects of President Donald Trump's tariff plans, but none have been seen yet, as many companies are still sorting through how they will be affected.  As first-quarter results roll out, you'll get more commentary on how tariffs will affect various businesses, but one very important company has already offered commentary on tariffs.  Taiwan Semiconductor (NYSE: TSM) is one of the world's most important companies, as it is the chip foundry for many of the world's top companies.
summary: Despite potential tariff risks from President Trump's plans, Taiwan Semiconductor (TSMC) reports no current impact on customer behavior and maintains a strong 2025 revenue growth outlook. TSMC's stock price hasn't reflected this positive outlook, presenting a potential buying opportunity for investors as the stock trades at a discount.

headline: Where Will TSMC Stock Be in 5 Years?
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE: TSM), popularly known as TSMC, has turned out to be a solid investment over the past five years.  It is expected to grow by double digits in 2025 as well, driven by the growing demand for chips in various applications such as communications, artificial intelligence (AI), defense, transportation, medical devices, and others.
summary: TSMC, the world's largest semiconductor foundry, is poised for significant growth, driven by high demand for its advanced chip manufacturing processes like the upcoming 2nm node from major players like Apple and Nvidia. Despite a recent stock dip, analysts are optimistic about TSMC's future, projecting substantial revenue growth and market share gains in the expanding semiconductor and advanced chip packaging markets over the next five years.

headline: Intel CEO in Talks with TSMC for Potential Partnership Amid Foundry Struggles
description: Insider Talks: Intel's New CEO Eyes Bold Partnership with TSMC to Jump-Start Chip Manufacturing
summary: Summary unavailable.

headline: 2 Bargain Stocks You Can't Afford to Miss Out on During the Stock Market Sell-Off
description: Two that I'm most excited about are Taiwan Semiconductor (NYSE: TSM) and The Trade Desk (NASDAQ: TTD).  Taiwan Semi is the leading contract chip manufacturer and has contracts with many of the largest tech companies around the globe.  Companies like Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) don't have chip production capabilities; they just handle end assembly of their chips.

headline: The Stock Market May Rise or Fall Sharply This Week Based on Key Reports From Amazon, Apple, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft
description: The S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) has declined 10% from its high as tariffs imposed by the Trump administration have rattled financial markets.  Investors will receive important data this week that could either alleviate or intensify concerns surrounding the trade war.  The Labor Department will release jobs, payroll, and unemployment numbers, and the Commerce Department will announce first-quarter GDP and consumer spending data for March.
summary: The S&P 500 has fallen 10% due to trade war concerns, and upcoming jobs reports and GDP data will be crucial in determining the economy's strength. Furthermore, financial results from major tech companies like Meta, Microsoft, Apple, and Amazon could also impact investor sentiment.

headline: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500 erase slide to rise for 5th straight day in lead up to Big Tech earnings
description: US stocks fluctuated on Monday with investors focused on Big Tech earnings for the week ahead.
summary: U.S. stocks closed mixed on Monday, recovering from earlier losses as investors brace for a week of significant earnings reports and key economic data releases, including inflation and GDP figures. The Dow and S&P 500 ended positively, while the Nasdaq lagged, amidst ongoing trade tension discussions and anticipation of Big Tech earnings. This week's reports and data will provide insight into the U.S. economy's response to tariffs.

headline: Stock Market Sell-Off: 3 "Magnificent Seven" Stocks Down 20% or More to Buy Right Now
description: Plenty of "Magnificent Seven" stocks are still down over 20% from all-time highs, including Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN), Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL), and Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META).  Here's why these three are perfect stocks to buy the dip on during this market volatility.  Meta Platforms owns three of the largest social media platforms in the world: Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.
summary: Despite a recent market rebound, technology stocks like Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta are still significantly down from their highs due to tariff concerns affecting 2025 earnings projections. However, the article argues this presents a buying opportunity, particularly for Meta and Alphabet, highlighting Meta's dominant market position and Alphabet's diverse growth streams as reasons for long-term investment. These two stocks have solid business models and focus on technological innovation.

headline: Magnificent Seven Stocks Tumble: Nvidia, Tesla Sell Off
description: Dubbed the Magnificent Seven stocks, Apple, Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon.com, Nvidia, Meta Platforms and Tesla lived up to their name in 2024 with solid gains. Through the first three months of 2025, however, performance for these mega-cap stocks has been negative thus far.
summary: The "Magnificent Seven" stocks, which performed strongly in 2024, have collectively experienced negative performance in the first quarter of 2025. This marks a shift from their previous dominance in the market.

headline: Jim Cramer Calls Meta Platforms (META) Antitrust Trial ‘Waste of Time’
description: We recently published a list of Top 10 Stocks to Watch as Investors Brace for Recession. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:META) stands against other top stocks to watch as investors brace for recession. Despite some optimism in the market after President Donald Trump’s indication […]
summary: Amid growing recession concerns fueled by tariffs and declining consumer sentiment, analysts are cautioning about a potential economic slowdown reflected in upcoming earnings reports. The article analyzes Meta Platforms Inc. (META) within a list of top stocks to watch, noting hedge fund interest and Jim Cramer's comments on Meta's antitrust trial. The article also highlights a strategy of following top hedge fund stock picks that has outperformed the market.

headline: 5 Key Lessons I've Learned From 7 Years of Stock Market Sell-Offs
description: Investors have been on such a turbulent roller coaster that it's easy to forget that the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) was up slightly through the first two months of the year.  With April coming to a close and the major indexes firmly in the red, investors may be wondering how long volatility will last, and if now is a good time to buy stocks or run for the exits.  Here are five lessons I've learned from major sell-offs over the last seven years, and how these lessons can help you navigate market uncertainty.
summary: The article discusses market sell-offs, using historical examples like 2018, 2020, and 2022 to illustrate key lessons for investors.  It emphasizes understanding that sell-offs are unpredictable, present opportunities to buy quality companies at discounted prices, and require a long-term investment horizon with manageable risk.  Ultimately, the article advocates for managing emotions and focusing on fundamentals to potentially benefit from market downturns.

headline: Mag 7 earnings, April jobs, Trump's first 100 days: 3 Things
description: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are moving higher to kick off what is dubbed the "busiest earnings week" for the S&P 500 (^GSPC) as Meta Platforms (META), Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), and Amazon (AMZN) prepare to release their quarterly results. The economic data expected out this week includes April's jobs report and March Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index. Lastly, the S&P 500 has reportedly fallen less than 8% in the first 100 days of President Trump's second administration. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
summary: US stock futures are stable ahead of a busy week with major corporate earnings reports from companies like Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and Meta. Investors are also awaiting key economic data, including GDP, PCE, and the April jobs report. The S&P 500 is down 8% since the current president's inauguration, marking its worst performance in a president's first 100 days since 1974.

headline: META Q1 Earnings Preview: What to Expect From Upcoming Report
description: Meta Platforms Poised for Strong Q1, But Analysts See Potential Risks
summary: Meta Platforms is set to release its Q1 earnings report, with expectations of strong ad revenue growth and increased EPS. However, analysts have recently lowered EPS forecasts, signaling potential concerns about the advertising market and competition. Investors will be closely watching Meta's spending on metaverse and AI projects, as well as guidance for the coming quarters, to assess the company's long-term strategy and valuation.

headline: Big Tech’s Earnings Problem Is Estimates May Be Way Too High

summary: US stock futures are stable ahead of a busy week with major corporate earnings reports from companies like Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and Meta. Investors are also awaiting key economic data, including GDP, PCE, and the April jobs report. The S&P 500 is down 8% since the current president's inauguration, marking its worst performance in a president's first 100 days since 1974.

headline: META Q1 Earnings Preview: What to Expect From Upcoming Report
description: Meta Platforms Poised for Strong Q1, But Analysts See Potential Risks
summary: Meta Platforms is set to release its Q1 earnings report, with expectations of strong ad revenue growth and increased EPS. However, analysts have recently lowered EPS forecasts, signaling potential concerns about the advertising market and competition. Investors will be closely watching Meta's spending on metaverse and AI projects, as well as guidance for the coming quarters, to assess the company's long-term strategy and valuation.

headline: Big Tech’s Earnings Problem Is Estimates May Be Way Too High

headline: The Stock Market May Rise or Fall Sharply This Week Based on Key Reports From Amazon, Apple, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft
description: The S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) has declined 10% from its high as tariffs imposed by the Trump administration have rattled financial markets.  Investors will receive important data this week that could either alleviate or intensify concerns surrounding the trade war.  The Labor Department will release jobs, payroll, and unemployment numbers, and the Commerce Department will announce first-quarter GDP and consumer spending data for March.
summary: The S&P 500 has fallen 10% due to trade war concerns, and upcoming jobs reports and GDP data will be crucial in determining the economy's strength. Furthermore, financial results from major tech companies like Meta, Microsoft, Apple, and Amazon could also impact investor sentiment.

headline: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500 erase slide to rise for 5th straight day in lead up to Big Tech earnings
description: US stocks fluctuated on Monday with investors focused on Big Tech earnings for the week ahead.
summary: U.S. stocks closed mixed on Monday, recovering from earlier losses as investors brace for a week of significant earnings reports and key economic data releases, including inflation and GDP figures. The Dow and S&P 500 ended positively, while the Nasdaq lagged, amidst ongoing trade tension discussions and anticipation of Big Tech earnings. This week's reports and data will provide insight into the U.S. economy's response to tariffs.

headline: Stock Market Sell-Off: 3 "Magnificent Seven" Stocks Down 20% or More to Buy Right Now
description: Plenty of "Magnificent Seven" stocks are still down over 20% from all-time highs, including Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN), Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL), and Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META).  Here's why these three are perfect stocks to buy the dip on during this market volatility.  Meta Platforms owns three of the largest social media platforms in the world: Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.
summary: Despite a recent market rebound, technology stocks like Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta are still significantly down from their highs due to tariff concerns affecting 2025 earnings projections. However, the article argues this presents a buying opportunity, particularly for Meta and Alphabet, highlighting Meta's dominant market position and Alphabet's diverse growth streams as reasons for long-term investment. These two stocks have solid business models and focus on technological innovation.

headline: Magnificent Seven Stocks Tumble: Nvidia, Tesla Sell Off
description: Dubbed the Magnificent Seven stocks, Apple, Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon.com, Nvidia, Meta Platforms and Tesla lived up to their name in 2024 with solid gains. Through the first three months of 2025, however, performance for these mega-cap stocks has been negative thus far.
summary: The "Magnificent Seven" stocks, which performed strongly in 2024, have collectively experienced negative performance in the first quarter of 2025. This marks a shift from their previous dominance in the market.

headline: Jim Cramer Calls Meta Platforms (META) Antitrust Trial ‘Waste of Time’
description: We recently published a list of Top 10 Stocks to Watch as Investors Brace for Recession. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:META) stands against other top stocks to watch as investors brace for recession. Despite some optimism in the market after President Donald Trump’s indication […]
summary: Amid growing recession concerns fueled by tariffs and declining consumer sentiment, analysts are cautioning about a potential economic slowdown reflected in upcoming earnings reports. The article analyzes Meta Platforms Inc. (META) within a list of top stocks to watch, noting hedge fund interest and Jim Cramer's comments on Meta's antitrust trial. The article also highlights a strategy of following top hedge fund stock picks that has outperformed the market.

headline: 5 Key Lessons I've Learned From 7 Years of Stock Market Sell-Offs
description: Investors have been on such a turbulent roller coaster that it's easy to forget that the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) was up slightly through the first two months of the year.  With April coming to a close and the major indexes firmly in the red, investors may be wondering how long volatility will last, and if now is a good time to buy stocks or run for the exits.  Here are five lessons I've learned from major sell-offs over the last seven years, and how these lessons can help you navigate market uncertainty.
summary: The article discusses market sell-offs, using historical examples like 2018, 2020, and 2022 to illustrate key lessons for investors.  It emphasizes understanding that sell-offs are unpredictable, present opportunities to buy quality companies at discounted prices, and require a long-term investment horizon with manageable risk.  Ultimately, the article advocates for managing emotions and focusing on fundamentals to potentially benefit from market downturns.

headline: Mag 7 earnings, April jobs, Trump's first 100 days: 3 Things

headline: Can ASML (ASML) Climb 35.34% to Reach the Level Wall Street Analysts Expect?
description: The consensus price target hints at a 35.3% upside potential for ASML (ASML). While empirical research shows that this sought-after metric is hardly effective, an upward trend in earnings estimate revisions could mean that the stock will witness an upside in the near term.
summary: ASML stock has slightly increased recently, and analysts' average price target suggests a potential 35.3% upside. However, analysts' price targets can be unreliable due to potential biases and business incentives. Despite the uncertainty around price targets, analysts agree on ASML's potential for better-than-expected earnings, which could drive further stock growth.

headline: ASML reports transactions under its current share buyback program
description: ASML reports transactions under its current share buyback program VELDHOVEN, the Netherlands – ASML Holding N.V. (ASML) reports the following transactions, conducted under ASML's current share buyback program. DateTotal repurchased sharesWeighted average priceTotal repurchased value21-Apr-25-*--22-Apr-2522,000€556.64€12,246,07123-Apr-2521,217€579.49€12,295,12424-Apr-2521,111€582.38€12,294,58625-Apr-2520,961€586.57€12,295,046 *Markets closed ASML’s current share buyback program was announced on 1
summary: ASML reports its daily share repurchases from April 22-25, 2025, under its existing buyback program announced in November 2022, totaling around €49.18 million in value. The buyback program aims to return value to shareholders and is being disclosed in compliance with Market Abuse Regulations.

headline: ASML Holding N.V. (ASML): Among AI Stocks That Will Skyrocket
description: We recently published a list of 10 AI Stocks That Will Skyrocket. In this article, we are going to take a look at where ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML) stands against other AI stocks that will skyrocket. AI (Artificial Intelligence) isn’t just a buzzword anymore—it’s becoming a part of our everyday lives, from the apps we […]
summary: The article discusses the investment potential of AI stocks, highlighting the sector's recent growth and potential buying opportunities amid current market weakness. It emphasizes the broad applications of AI, particularly in healthcare and generative AI, and the importance of high-performance chips and software for developing advanced AI solutions.

headline: If You Invested $10K In ASML Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now?
description: ASML Holding (NASDAQ:ASML) provides lithography solutions for the development, production, marketing, sales, upgrading, and servicing of advanced semiconductor equipment systems. If You Bought ASML Stock 10 Years Ago The company's stock traded at approximately $108.69 per share 10 years ago. If you had invested $10,000, you could have bought roughly 92 shares. Currently, shares trade at $638.69, meaning your investment's value could have grown to $58,763 from stock price appreciation alone. Howe
summary: A $10,000 investment in ASML stock ten years ago would now be worth approximately $62,937, including dividends, significantly outperforming the S&P 500. While Q1 2025 revenue and EPS declined sequentially, ASML projects continued growth with a positive full-year outlook, maintaining an "Overweight" rating and a potential 33% upside based on analysts' price targets.

headline: 3 Growth Stocks Down 30% or More to Buy Right Now
description: Pinpointing strong bargains in the stock market is key to success, and the market is full of them right now.  Three companies that are down more than 30% from their all-time highs and look like excellent buys are Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), Taiwan Semiconductor (NYSE: TSM), and ASML (NASDAQ: ASML).  As a quick overview of the supply chain, Nvidia places Taiwan Semiconductor's chips in its GPUs (graphics processing units), which have been the primary computing unit deployed by the AI hyperscalers.
summary: The article highlights Nvidia, Taiwan Semiconductor, and ASML as strong long-term buys, despite recent drops, due to their critical roles in the AI chip value chain.  Analysts project substantial growth in AI-related revenue for these companies, driven by increasing demand for data centers and advanced chips. Investors are encouraged to focus on the long-term potential of AI investments despite potential short-term market fluctuations.

headline: Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) Collaborates With U.S. Department Of Defense For Secure Cloud Infrastructure
description: Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) saw a significant 13% increase in its share price over the past week, possibly bolstered by several recent announcements. Notably, the availability of SONIFI's SORA on the Oracle Cloud Marketplace reflects the company's ongoing expansion in cloud services, enhancing guest experience technologies. Additionally, Oracle's collaboration with the U.S. Department of Defense to provide secure cloud infrastructure aligns with its strategic growth ambitions in government contracts,...
summary: Oracle's stock surged 13% last week, driven by cloud expansion initiatives like the integration of SONIFI's SORA and a partnership with the U.S. Department of Defense. Despite outperforming the market, Oracle is trading at a 28% discount to analysts' price target of $178.12, suggesting potential for further growth based on projected revenue and earnings.

headline: Tesla's "Moment of Truth"
description: Tesla's net income decreased by 71% compared to a year ago. But Wall Street doesn't seem to mind.
summary: Tesla's recent earnings report revealed concerns in its automotive segment with lower operating margins and decreased vehicle deliveries, though this was offset by strong performance in energy and storage.  Despite the disappointing automotive results, Tesla's stock rose due to Elon Musk's statement that he would refocus on the company, signaling potential brand revitalization and strategic direction.  Analysts believe AMD, while currently behind NVIDIA in GPU technology and market share, is positioned for future growth due to its diversified business model, strategic acquisitions, and potential to offer cost-effective solutions for AI and data processing.

headline: Oracle’s OCI deploys thousands of NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs
description: Investing.com -- Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) announced Monday the deployment of thousands of NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA) Blackwell GPUs, marking a significant enhancement of its Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). The first wave of liquid-cooled NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 racks has been set up and optimized in Oracle’s data centers, ready for customer use. These deployments are aimed at developing and running advanced reasoning models and AI agents on the NVIDIA DGX Cloud and OCI.
summary: Oracle has deployed thousands of NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs in its Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), including the first liquid-cooled GB200 NVL72 racks, to enhance AI development and deployment capabilities. This deployment aims to support advanced AI models and applications, offering scalable, low-latency performance with NVIDIA's networking and Oracle's software integrations. OCI plans to build one of the world's largest Blackwell clusters to meet the growing demand for AI computing.

headline: North York General Becomes First Hospital in Canada to Migrate EHR to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
description: North York General Hospital (NYGH) in Toronto, Canada, has improved the performance and usability of its Oracle Health Foundation electronic health record (EHR) by migrating it to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). With OCI, NYGH is able to offer a better experience for its patients and providers and enable a more agile approach to adopting new technologies like generative AI.
summary: North York General Hospital (NYGH) in Toronto has migrated its Oracle Health Foundation electronic health record (EHR) to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). This move has improved EHR performance, reduced system latency, enhanced data security, and increased scalability for NYGH. These improvements ultimately lead to more efficient clinical workflows and better patient care through faster access to information and the ability to adopt advanced technologies like AI.

headline: Should You Invest in Oracle (ORCL) Based on Bullish Wall Street Views?
description: The average brokerage recommendation (ABR) for Oracle (ORCL) is equivalent to a Buy. The overly optimistic recommendations of Wall Street analysts make the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric questionable. So, is it worth buying the stock?
summary: This article discusses the reliability of Wall Street analyst recommendations, using Oracle (ORCL) as an example where a consensus suggests buying.  It cautions against relying solely on these recommendations due to potential bias from brokerage firms and suggests using them to validate other investment tools, like the Zacks Rank, for better informed decisions. The article also explains the difference between ABR and Zack's Rank.

headline: Oracle (ORCL) Outpaces Stock Market Gains: What You Should Know
description: In the closing of the recent trading day, Oracle (ORCL) stood at $138.56, denoting a +0.76% change from the preceding trading day.
summary: Oracle's stock (ORCL) slightly outperformed the S&P 500 with a 0.76% gain in the latest trading session, though it has underperformed both the S&P 500 and its sector over the past month.  Analysts anticipate growth in Oracle's upcoming financial results, but the company currently holds a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) due to recent downward revisions in EPS estimates, despite having a relatively lower Forward P/E ratio than its industry average.

headline: Jim Cramer Sees Oracle (ORCL) as Inexpensive: “Stock’s Been Hurt but Has Value”

Ultimately, Cramer suggests Trump now "owns Wall Street" and decides whether its performance is good or bad.

On Wednesday, Jim Cramer, the host of Mad Money, took to discussing how President Donald Trump’s influence […]
summary: Jim Cramer discussed how President Trump's influence significantly impacts the stock market, noting Trump's ability to ease market tensions with pronouncements on social media and policy suggestions. The article then lists 16 stocks that Cramer discussed on Mad Money, including Oracle, and includes hedge fund sentiment for each. Ultimately, Cramer suggests Trump now "owns Wall Street" and decides whether its performance is good or bad.

headline: Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) Collaborates With U.S. Department Of Defense For Secure Cloud Infrastructure
description: Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) saw a significant 13% increase in its share price over the past week, possibly bolstered by several recent announcements. Notably, the availability of SONIFI's SORA on the Oracle Cloud Marketplace reflects the company's ongoing expansion in cloud services, enhancing guest experience technologies. Additionally, Oracle's collaboration with the U.S. Department of Defense to provide secure cloud infrastructure aligns with its strategic growth ambitions in government contracts,...
summary: Oracle's stock surged 13% last week, driven by cloud expansion initiatives like the integration of SONIFI's SORA and a partnership with the U.S. Department of Defense. Despite outperforming the market, Oracle is trading at a 28% discount to analysts' price target of $178.12, suggesting potential for further growth based on projected revenue and earnings.

headline: Tesla's "Moment of Truth"
description: Tesla's net income decreased by 71% compared to a year ago. But Wall Street doesn't seem to mind.
summary: Tesla's recent earnings report revealed concerns in its automotive segment with lower operating margins and decreased vehicle deliveries, though this was offset by strong performance in energy and storage.  Despite the disappointing automotive results, Tesla's stock rose due to Elon Musk's statement that he would refocus on the company, signaling potential brand revitalization and strategic direction.  Analysts believe AMD, while currently behind NVIDIA in GPU technology and market share, is positioned for future growth due to its diversified business model, strategic acquisitions, and potential to offer cost-effective solutions for AI and data processing.

headline: Oracle’s OCI deploys thousands of NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs
description: Investing.com -- Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) announced Monday the deployment of thousands of NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA) Blackwell GPUs, marking a significant enhancement of its Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). The first wave of liquid-cooled NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 racks has been set up and optimized in Oracle’s data centers, ready for customer use. These deployments are aimed at developing and running advanced reasoning models and AI agents on the NVIDIA DGX Cloud and OCI.
summary: Oracle has deployed thousands of NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs in its Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), including the first liquid-cooled GB200 NVL72 racks, to enhance AI development and deployment capabilities. This deployment aims to support advanced AI models and applications, offering scalable, low-latency performance with NVIDIA's networking and Oracle's software integrations. OCI plans to build one of the world's largest Blackwell clusters to meet the growing demand for AI computing.

headline: North York General Becomes First Hospital in Canada to Migrate EHR to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
description: North York General Hospital (NYGH) in Toronto, Canada, has improved the performance and usability of its Oracle Health Foundation electronic health record (EHR) by migrating it to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). With OCI, NYGH is able to offer a better experience for its patients and providers and enable a more agile approach to adopting new technologies like generative AI.
summary: North York General Hospital (NYGH) in Toronto has migrated its Oracle Health Foundation electronic health record (EHR) to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). This move has improved EHR performance, reduced system latency, enhanced data security, and increased scalability for NYGH. These improvements ultimately lead to more efficient clinical workflows and better patient care through faster access to information and the ability to adopt advanced technologies like AI.

headline: Should You Invest in Oracle (ORCL) Based on Bullish Wall Street Views?
description: The average brokerage recommendation (ABR) for Oracle (ORCL) is equivalent to a Buy. The overly optimistic recommendations of Wall Street analysts make the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric questionable. So, is it worth buying the stock?
summary: This article discusses the reliability of Wall Street analyst recommendations, using Oracle (ORCL) as an example where a consensus suggests buying.  It cautions against relying solely on these recommendations due to potential bias from brokerage firms and suggests using them to validate other investment tools, like the Zacks Rank, for better informed decisions. The article also explains the difference between ABR and Zack's Rank.

headline: Oracle (ORCL) Outpaces Stock Market Gains: What You Should Know
description: In the closing of the recent trading day, Oracle (ORCL) stood at $138.56, denoting a +0.76% change from the preceding trading day.
summary: Oracle's stock (ORCL) slightly outperformed the S&P 500 with a 0.76% gain in the latest trading session, though it has underperformed both the S&P 500 and its sector over the past month.  Analysts anticipate growth in Oracle's upcoming financial results, but the company currently holds a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) due to recent downward revisions in EPS estimates, despite having a relatively lower Forward P/E ratio than its industry average.

headline: Super Micro Computer Stock Plunges. Is This a Buying Opportunity?
description: The company continues to face intense margin pressure.  While the stock isn't expensive, it needs to find a better way to handle chip architecture transitions.  One of the most volatile stocks over the past year or so, Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) continued its habit of making big moves after its shares tumbled following the company's pre-announcement of poor fiscal Q3 earnings results.
summary: Supermicro's stock is down following a pre-announcement of poor Q3 earnings due to continued margin pressure. While the company benefits from the AI infrastructure buildout as a key OEM partner for Nvidia, it struggles with low gross margins in a highly competitive field. Investors are concerned about Supermicro's ability to navigate chip architecture transitions effectively.

headline: Nvidia Just Got Its First Sell Rating From Wall Street -- Should Investors Be Worried?
description: Seaport Global Securities analyst Jay Goldberg just issued a sell rating on the stock and a new price target that is the lowest on Wall Street.  The artificial intelligence chip king, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), has been on a long, dominant run for several years now.  Seaport Global Securities analyst Jay Goldberg recently downgraded Nvidia to a sell rating and issued a $100 price target, the lowest on Wall Street.
summary: A Seaport Global analyst downgraded Nvidia to a "sell" rating with a $100 price target, citing concerns that the benefits of AI are already priced into the stock and that major clients may develop their own chips. Despite the downgrade and potential challenges in 2025, the article suggests Nvidia's market leadership and reasonable valuation make it a long-term buy for investors optimistic about AI.

headline: Think Nvidia Is Expensive? These 3 Charts Might Change Your Mind.
description: Nvidia is now one of the most valuable companies in the world.  Over the past five years, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock has risen in value by nearly 1,500%, making it one of the most valuable companies in the world.
summary: Despite its massive growth and high market capitalization, the article argues that Nvidia's stock is not overvalued when considering its earnings, particularly its forward price-to-earnings ratio.  Nvidia's rapid growth in the AI sector is expected to further reduce its valuation premium relative to the market in the future. The article suggests this presents a potentially lucrative opportunity for long-term investors.

headline: Does Seaport Research Know Something the Rest of Wall Street Doesn't? Analysts There Just Gave Nvidia a Sell Rating.
description: Nvidia has delivered double- and triple-digit revenue growth as artificial intelligence customers flocked to its chips and other products.  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock has slipped in recent times along with many other stocks -- especially technology players -- as investors worried about the impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs on imports.  The artificial intelligence (AI) boom continues, with companies continuing major investments to build out infrastructure, and as the chip leader, Nvidia stands to benefit.
summary: Despite widespread Wall Street optimism, Seaport Global Securities initiated a "sell" rating on Nvidia, suggesting the AI chip leader's growth potential is already priced in and citing potential slowdowns in customer spending. This contrasts with the general consensus that Nvidia will continue to benefit from the booming AI market and maintain its high revenue growth, despite short-term risks like tariffs. Overall, the article maintains a bullish long-term outlook on Nvidia, advising investors to buy and hold.

headline: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: Nvidia vs. Intel
description: Both Nvidia and Intel should benefit immensely.  When it comes to investing in artificial intelligence (AI), buying shares of graphics processing unit (GPU) manufacturers like Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) and Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) can be a wise decision.  Nearly every AI application requires these specialized chips to function, and buying stock in a GPU maker gives your portfolio direct exposure to the entire AI industry.
summary: Demand for AI chips is surging, benefiting Nvidia, the current market leader, and potentially Intel, despite its current struggles. While Nvidia dominates the AI chip market, Intel's low valuation and growth plans make it a potentially interesting, albeit riskier, investment.

headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang gets first salary boost in 10 years
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang got his first major salary bump since 2015 — but it’s still less than half of the salaries of executives at Microsoft and Apple.
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang received a 50% salary increase, bringing his base pay to $1.49 million, his first major raise since 2015.  The increase was implemented to align his compensation with that of peer company CEOs and due to the company's soaring stock price. While his base salary is lower than some other tech CEOs, his total compensation package, boosted by Nvidia's performance, is significantly higher.

headline: Magnificent Seven Stocks: Meta, Nvidia, Tesla Rally; Apple Dives On Earnings
description: Dubbed the Magnificent Seven stocks, Apple, Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon.com, Nvidia, Meta Platforms and Tesla lived up to their name in 2024 with solid gains. Through the first four months of 2025, however, performance for these mega-cap stocks has been negative thus far.
summary: The Trump administration is considering relaxing restrictions on Nvidia chip sales to the UAE and may announce a bilateral chip deal during an upcoming trip to the Gulf. Discussions are ongoing regarding adjustments to AI chip restrictions specifically for the UAE.

headline: Why CoreWeave Stock Rose 11% in April
description: Shares could swing wildly following its debut earnings report on May 14.  Shares of CoreWeave (NASDAQ: CRWV) had a volatile April along with much of the stock market, but the recent IPO ended up with positive gains after a lackluster debut at the end of March.  There wasn't much news out on CoreWeave in April, as investors await its first earnings report as a public company on May 14, but the stock proved to be highly sensitive to news from the artificial intelligence (AI) sector, swinging multiple times on news from peer stocks, and due to macro news.
summary: CoreWeave stock experienced volatility in April, influenced by news in the broader AI market after its recent IPO.  The stock initially surged on positive OpenAI news but then declined due to tariff and economic slowdown concerns.  Investors are awaiting the company's first earnings report on May 14, which is expected to cause further stock fluctuations.

headline: Top Stock Movers Now: Dexcom, Berkshire Hathaway, Nvidia, and More
description: The economy created more jobs than anticipated in April, sending U.S. equities higher at midday.
summary: U.S. equities rose midday after a stronger-than-expected jobs report in April, with Berkshire Hathaway reaching a record high. However, Apple shares declined due to concerns about tariff costs, while Block and Hologic experienced drops due to weaker financials and cautious outlooks.

headline: Super Micro Computer Stock Plunges. Is This a Buying Opportunity?
description: The company continues to face intense margin pressure.  While the stock isn't expensive, it needs to find a better way to handle chip architecture transitions.  One of the most volatile stocks over the past year or so, Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) continued its habit of making big moves after its shares tumbled following the company's pre-announcement of poor fiscal Q3 earnings results.
summary: Supermicro's stock plummeted after pre-announcing weak Q3 results, signaling continued margin pressure in its hardware integration business. The company, which benefits from AI infrastructure buildout as a key Nvidia partner, faces intense competition and struggles with chip architecture transitions, impacting profitability. Despite being current with filings after previous accounting concerns, the disappointing results raise questions about its ability to navigate a commoditized market.

headline: Nvidia Just Got Its First Sell Rating From Wall Street -- Should Investors Be Worried?
description: Seaport Global Securities analyst Jay Goldberg just issued a sell rating on the stock and a new price target that is the lowest on Wall Street.  The artificial intelligence chip king, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), has been on a long, dominant run for several years now.  Seaport Global Securities analyst Jay Goldberg recently downgraded Nvidia to a sell rating and issued a $100 price target, the lowest on Wall Street.
summary: A Seaport Global Securities analyst has downgraded Nvidia to a sell rating with a $100 price target, citing concerns that the benefits of AI are already priced in and that major customers may design their own chips. While the analyst believes Nvidia faces a tough near-term outlook, the article suggests the company's dominant position and reasonable valuation make it a long-term buy for investors bullish on AI. The article also notes the analyst is bearish due to the belief that AI budgets will slow in 2026.

headline: Think Nvidia Is Expensive? These 3 Charts Might Change Your Mind.
description: Nvidia is now one of the most valuable companies in the world.  Over the past five years, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock has risen in value by nearly 1,500%, making it one of the most valuable companies in the world.
summary: Despite its massive growth and high market cap, Nvidia's stock, while expensive based on price-to-sales, is considered relatively affordable for long-term investors when considering its price-to-earnings ratio, especially its forward earnings.  Nvidia's continued growth in the AI market is expected to further reduce its valuation premium, potentially making it an even more attractive investment.

headline: Does Seaport Research Know Something the Rest of Wall Street Doesn't? Analysts There Just Gave Nvidia a Sell Rating.
description: Nvidia has delivered double- and triple-digit revenue growth as artificial intelligence customers flocked to its chips and other products.  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock has slipped in recent times along with many other stocks -- especially technology players -- as investors worried about the impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs on imports.  The artificial intelligence (AI) boom continues, with companies continuing major investments to build out infrastructure, and as the chip leader, Nvidia stands to benefit.
summary: Despite concerns about potential tariffs, most analysts recommend buying Nvidia stock due to its dominant position in the growing AI chip market and strong financial performance. The average forecast predicts significant stock growth in the next year, although one firm recently issued a "sell" rating, creating some uncertainty. Nvidia's AI-focused products and services have fueled substantial revenue growth and profitability.

headline: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: Nvidia vs. Intel
description: Both Nvidia and Intel should benefit immensely.  When it comes to investing in artificial intelligence (AI), buying shares of graphics processing unit (GPU) manufacturers like Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) and Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) can be a wise decision.  Nearly every AI application requires these specialized chips to function, and buying stock in a GPU maker gives your portfolio direct exposure to the entire AI industry.
summary: Demand for AI chips is surging, primarily benefiting Nvidia, which dominates the market, while Intel lags behind. Despite Nvidia's current dominance, Intel's significantly lower valuation and potential for growth make it a potentially interesting investment, especially considering its gross margins.

headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang gets first salary boost in 10 years
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang got his first major salary bump since 2015 — but it’s still less than half of the salaries of executives at Microsoft and Apple.
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang received a 50% salary increase to $1.49 million, his first major raise since 2015, to align his pay more closely with peers.  Although Huang's base salary was lower than some other tech CEOs, his total compensation, largely driven by Nvidia's stock performance, has been significantly higher.  The compensation committee felt that this decision was appropiate in consideration of internal pay equity with the base salaries of other named executive officers, given that this was Huang's first base salary increase in 10 years.

headline: Magnificent Seven Stocks: Meta, Nvidia, Tesla Rally; Apple Dives On Earnings
description: Dubbed the Magnificent Seven stocks, Apple, Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon.com, Nvidia, Meta Platforms and Tesla lived up to their name in 2024 with solid gains. Through the first four months of 2025, however, performance for these mega-cap stocks has been negative thus far.
summary: The "Magnificent Seven" stocks, which performed strongly in 2024, have experienced negative performance in the first four months of 2025. This signals a potential shift in market leadership after a period of dominance by these mega-cap companies.

headline: Why CoreWeave Stock Rose 11% in April
description: Shares could swing wildly following its debut earnings report on May 14.  Shares of CoreWeave (NASDAQ: CRWV) had a volatile April along with much of the stock market, but the recent IPO ended up with positive gains after a lackluster debut at the end of March.  There wasn't much news out on CoreWeave in April, as investors await its first earnings report as a public company on May 14, but the stock proved to be highly sensitive to news from the artificial intelligence (AI) sector, swinging multiple times on news from peer stocks, and due to macro news.
summary: CoreWeave stock experienced volatility in April, primarily influenced by broader news within the AI sector and macroeconomic concerns, resulting in an overall gain of 11% for the month.  The stock's performance was sensitive to events such as OpenAI's funding round and potential deals with Google, while also reacting to tariff announcements and economic slowdown fears. Investors are now awaiting CoreWeave's first earnings report as a public company on May 14, which could lead to further stock fluctuations.

headline: Top Stock Movers Now: Dexcom, Berkshire Hathaway, Nvidia, and More
description: The economy created more jobs than anticipated in April, sending U.S. equities higher at midday.
summary: Summary unavailable.

headline: Super Micro Computer Stock Plunges. Is This a Buying Opportunity?
description: The company continues to face intense margin pressure.  While the stock isn't expensive, it needs to find a better way to handle chip architecture transitions.  One of the most volatile stocks over the past year or so, Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) continued its habit of making big moves after its shares tumbled following the company's pre-announcement of poor fiscal Q3 earnings results.
summary: Supermicro's stock plummeted after pre-announcing weak Q3 results, signaling continued margin pressure in its hardware integration business. The company, which benefits from AI infrastructure buildout as a key Nvidia partner, faces intense competition and struggles with chip architecture transitions, impacting profitability. Despite being current with filings after previous accounting concerns, the disappointing results raise questions about its ability to navigate a commoditized market.

headline: Nvidia Just Got Its First Sell Rating From Wall Street -- Should Investors Be Worried?
description: Seaport Global Securities analyst Jay Goldberg just issued a sell rating on the stock and a new price target that is the lowest on Wall Street.  The artificial intelligence chip king, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), has been on a long, dominant run for several years now.  Seaport Global Securities analyst Jay Goldberg recently downgraded Nvidia to a sell rating and issued a $100 price target, the lowest on Wall Street.
summary: A Seaport Global Securities analyst has downgraded Nvidia to a sell rating with a $100 price target, citing concerns that the benefits of AI are already priced in and that major customers may design their own chips. While the analyst believes Nvidia faces a tough near-term outlook, the article suggests the company's dominant position and reasonable valuation make it a long-term buy for investors bullish on AI. The article also notes the analyst is bearish due to the belief that AI budgets will slow in 2026.

headline: Think Nvidia Is Expensive? These 3 Charts Might Change Your Mind.
description: Nvidia is now one of the most valuable companies in the world.  Over the past five years, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock has risen in value by nearly 1,500%, making it one of the most valuable companies in the world.
summary: Despite its massive growth and high market cap, Nvidia's stock, while expensive based on price-to-sales, is considered relatively affordable for long-term investors when considering its price-to-earnings ratio, especially its forward earnings.  Nvidia's continued growth in the AI market is expected to further reduce its valuation premium, potentially making it an even more attractive investment.

headline: Does Seaport Research Know Something the Rest of Wall Street Doesn't? Analysts There Just Gave Nvidia a Sell Rating.
description: Nvidia has delivered double- and triple-digit revenue growth as artificial intelligence customers flocked to its chips and other products.  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock has slipped in recent times along with many other stocks -- especially technology players -- as investors worried about the impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs on imports.  The artificial intelligence (AI) boom continues, with companies continuing major investments to build out infrastructure, and as the chip leader, Nvidia stands to benefit.
summary: Despite concerns about potential tariffs, most analysts recommend buying Nvidia stock due to its dominant position in the growing AI chip market and strong financial performance. The average forecast predicts significant stock growth in the next year, although one firm recently issued a "sell" rating, creating some uncertainty. Nvidia's AI-focused products and services have fueled substantial revenue growth and profitability.

description: Both Nvidia and Intel should benefit immensely. headline: 3 Semiconductor Stocks That Could Help Make You a Fortune
description: TSMC, ASML, and Arm still look like a great long-term plays in the growing market.
summary: Despite recent sector slumps due to trade tensions and recession fears, TSMC, ASML, and Arm are highlighted as long-term investment opportunities due to their crucial technologies and anticipated growth driven by the expanding cloud and AI markets. TSMC is the leading chipmaker, ASML dominates chip production tech, and Arm's designs gain traction, positioning them for strong future revenue and earnings growth. Analysts suggest now might be a good time to invest in these stocks.

headline: Here Are My Top 4 Stocks to Buy in May
description: The artificial intelligence arms race remains ongoing -- and certain to grow.  Nvidia and Taiwan Semiconductor are key to supplying the necessary chips.  Alphabet and MercadoLibre are actively integrating AI into everything they do.
summary: The article highlights Nvidia and Alphabet as strong investment opportunities due to their key roles in the growing AI sector. Nvidia is benefiting from increased data center spending, while Alphabet is integrating AI despite facing potential legal and tariff challenges. The author suggests that the market presents good values, making "sell in May and go away" an unsuitable strategy this year.

headline: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (TSM): Among Ken Fisher’s Technology Stock Picks with Huge Upside Potential
description: We recently published an article titled Billionaire Ken Fisher’s 10 Technology Stock Picks with Huge Upside Potential. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (NYSE:TSM) stands against the other technology stocks. Technology stocks have faced heightened volatility in 2025, with market sentiment swinging sharply in response […]
summary: Technology stocks experienced volatility in early 2025 due to trade policy concerns, but analysts project Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) has significant upside potential. Despite geopolitical risks and the rise of other AI stocks, TSMC's dominance in advanced chip manufacturing and strong financial performance position it as a key investment in the tech sector, with Ken Fisher holding a substantial stake. The article also mentioned Billionaire Ken Fisher's 10 Technology Stock Picks with Huge Upside Potential.

headline: 2 AI Stocks to Buy and Hold for 10 Years
description: C3.ai recently formed strategic partnerships with leading cloud services that could expand its sales potential.  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing plans to increase capital spending this year to support growing demand for AI chips.  The recent sell-off in tech stocks is a great opportunity to buy shares of leading artificial intelligence (AI) companies at a discount.
summary: The AI market is projected to reach $1 trillion by 2030, creating investment opportunities in leading AI companies.  Specifically, C3.ai, with its strategic partnerships and growing revenue, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, a key chip supplier for AI applications, are highlighted as potential beneficiaries of this growth, making the recent tech stock sell-off an opportune time to invest.

headline: The AI trade will have 'multiple winners': Strategist's picks
description: Meta Platforms (META) and Microsoft's (MSFT) most recent earnings releases have seen significant growth in the tech giants' AI segments, with Wall Street expecting artificial intelligence gains to offset substantial CapEx investments. Hennion & Walsh CIO Kevin Mahn joins The Morning Brief team to discuss the latest chapter in AI revolution forecasts amid trade tariff concerns, naming other AI-exposed stocks to consider beyond Nvidia (NVDA). Also catch KeyBanc Capital Markets' John Vinh explain to Yahoo Finance why Nvidia is still a buy. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
summary: The discussion revolves around companies potentially leveraging US government incentives for investments, primarily by optimizing existing infrastructure rather than building new facilities.  Nvidia is highlighted as a key player in the AI revolution, but the speaker suggests investors also consider other companies within the AI supply chain, including data centers, cooling solutions, utility companies, and semiconductor manufacturers, to diversify their AI-related investments. While remaining positive on Nvidia, the speaker emphasizes the broader AI ecosystem's potential.

headline: TSM named new top pick at Morgan Stanley on AI demand
description: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley moved Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing back to a top pick, citing strong AI-driven capital spending from major tech firms and the easing of several key concerns.
summary: Morgan Stanley upgraded Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC) to a top pick, driven by strong AI-related capital expenditure from companies like Meta and Microsoft. The upgrade addresses previous concerns around AI demand sustainability, potential Intel partnerships, and semiconductor tariffs, all of which have eased. Morgan Stanley believes TSMC is attractively valued compared to its peers and anticipates a rebound in the stock price.

headline: Amazon & Apple earnings, TSM to expand in US, Temu vs. tariffs
description: Yahoo Finance host Madison Mills tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Apple (AAPL) and Amazon's (AMZN) move into negative territory following their latest earnings results, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM) expanding its chip manufacturing in Arizona, and Chinese e-commerce platform Temu — a subsidiary of PDD Holdings (PDD) — pivoting its business model to circumvent tariffs. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
summary: Stocks rose following a positive jobs report and easing US-China trade concerns. While Apple and Amazon shares declined post-earnings due to tariff impacts and softer guidance respectively, Taiwan Semiconductor saw gains after Apple announced increased US chip sourcing, a boon for TSMC's expansion. Temu's parent company, PDD, also experienced a stock increase as it shifts its business model to avoid tariffs by recruiting US merchants.

headline: Taiwan Semiconductor Gains On Strong Earnings From Meta And Microsoft Boosting AI Demand
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (NYSE:TSM) stock is trading higher Friday in sympathy with customers Meta Platforms, Inc (NASDAQ:META) and Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ:MSFT) this week’s quarterly financial results. Meta reported its first-quarter financial results after the market closed on Wednesday. Its revenue was $42.31 billion, up 16%, beating analyst estimates of $41.39 billion. Also Read: Taiwan Semiconductor Breaks Ground On Third Arizona Plant Without US Subsidies Amid Trump Tariff Thre
summary: TSMC stock rose due to positive earnings reports from major customers Meta and Microsoft, indicating continued strong AI demand. This performance alleviated concerns about tariff disruptions and attracted bargain hunters, with Morgan Stanley reiterating TSMC as a top pick based on AI-driven capital spending. The strong financial results from these tech giants are bolstering the Taiex.

headline: Amazon & Apple earnings, TSM to expand in US, Temu vs. tariffs
description: Yahoo Finance host Madison Mills tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Apple (AAPL) and Amazon's (AMZN) move into negative territory following their latest earnings results, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM) expanding its chip manufacturing in Arizona, and Chinese e-commerce platform Temu — a subsidiary of PDD Holdings (PDD) — pivoting its business model to circumvent tariffs. Temu's parent company, PDD, also experienced a stock increase as it shifts its business model to avoid tariffs by recruiting US merchants.
